description: Sardinia is the second-largest island in the Mediterranean Sea.

names.details: Pliny the Elder remarks that Myrsilus called Sardinia "Ichnusa" as the island was shaped like a footprint.

references.formattedCitation: Plinius Secundus Maior, C. Naturalis Historiae. Edited by Karl Friedrich Theodor Mayhoff. Bibliotheca Scriptorum Graecorum et Romanorum Teubneriana. Lipsiae: Teubner, 1906. http://latin.packhum.org/loc/978/1/0.

names.details: Pliny the Elder remarks that Timaeus called Sardinia "Sandaliotis" as the island was shaped like the sole of a shoe.
